boardgame.name: Eketorp
Eketorp: Die Wikingerburg
Eketorp: The Viking Stronghold
boardgame.description: This text refers to the Queen 2007 reprint. The older edition had players write down their viking orders and was two rounds longer._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In Eketorp, players build Viking strongholds upon the Swedish island of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;Ouml;land._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The goal of the game is to collect the most valuable blocks to build your own fortress, either by winning battles on the resource spaces or by stealing blocks from other vikings._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Each turn, new resources appear and the players secretly plan their viking movements. After all the placements are revealed, vikings battle each other for blocks (with the losers sent off to the field hospital to recover). The game ends after a set number of rounds, or when one of the players has succeeded in finishing their fortress._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

Rio Grande Games (RIO A02) Number of players: 3-6 Age of players: 8++ Length: 45-60 minutes Game Description: The Viking fortress Eketorp on the north side of the Baltic Sea island Øland needs reinforcing against enemy attacks. The viking chiefs send out their men to bring back the necessary construction materials for the fort. But supplies are rare and battles must be fought to gain them. Even the most daring Vikings often return empty-handed and need to have their wounds attended to. Obtain the most valuable building blocks for your fort, protect your walls and make it to the end of the game as the viking chief with the strongest fortress. A fast-paced exciting game for all the family for 3 to 6 courageous Vikings. Author: Dirk Henn
